== Main Inclusion Report for upstart ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/u/upstart, available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Required component of ReplacementInit
 0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=upstart|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=upstart|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running suid/sgid.
** All binaries run as root, and check uid before allowing to be run.
** Daemon listens on a abstract-namespace UNIX domain port, and checks credentials of all incoming messages.
** Source code review: shallow review ok, thorough one pending
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box without configuration.
** Package does not ask any debconf questions higher than priority 'normal'.
** Maintained in house.
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards.
** Standard debhelper/cdbs/dbs packaging, standard patch system.
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in main.
